page.title: 05WOODLANDS VILLAGE
page.content: { Woodlands}is a large village situated on the Great North Road some 4 miles north-west of Doncaster.Original area was wooded parkland owned by Brodsworth Estate.Village built to provide homes for miners at Brodsworth colliery in 1907 and was designed by Percy Houston of Chesterfield as model village based on "Garden City Principle".Was first model village and has been regarded as example of excellent town planning. Visited by King George V and Queen Mary in 1912. Increased need for housing has meant falling standards in village.Now village is badly designed. Majority of village still serves colliery but smaller industries provide work for residents who number 4576.It is close knit community with many activities based on Miner's Welfare(1923) and local Leisure Centre(l972).
